p: The total sample was predominantly female ( n = 102; 85.0%). More than half of study participants were aged 30 to 39 years ( n = 67; 55.8%). Seventeen (14.2%) had immigrated to Germany, although they had been living in Germany for at least seven years. Among the interviewees, about 81% ( n = 97) were married, 13% ( n = 16) were in a partnership, and 6% ( n = 7) were single parents. The sample shows an overall high level of education, because more than half ( n = 63; 52.5%) of the participants had a University degree, and 47.5% ( n = 57) had a secondary school exam qualifying them for University admission ( Table 1).
